segments.text: It's heartbreaking to see the sink overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water just keeps pouring out, ruining the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The poor woman has no idea her foot is in the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children, climbing so dangerously on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's balance looks so precarious; he could fall hard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting innocently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems so peaceful in contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't anyone noticing these hazards?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes are stacked high, maybe they'll break in the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinets make the kitchen feel exposed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel sorry for the family; this could end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The towel in her hand is the only calm thing here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Such a simple scene, yet so full of potential sorrow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The daylight streaming in only highlights the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
